title: Tadoba National Park
subtitle: Tiger Territory of Maharashtra
overview: Tadoba Andhari Tiger Reserve is Maharashtra’s oldest and largest national park, renowned for its high density of tigers and rich biodiversity.
Located in the Chandrapur district, the park is a blend of deciduous forests, meadows, rivers, and lakes—making it a haven for wildlife photographers and nature lovers.
Tadoba offers thrilling jeep safaris, guided nature walks, and birdwatching opportunities, with the chance to spot tigers, leopards, sloth bears, and over 200 bird species.

highlights.title: Tiger Sightings
highlights.description: One of the highest chances to spot wild tigers in India.

highlights.title: Jeep Safaris
highlights.description: Morning and evening safaris led by trained naturalists.

highlights.title: Birdwatching
highlights.description: Home to eagles, owls, paradise flycatchers, and more.

highlights.title: Tadoba Lake
highlights.description: Scenic freshwater lake where animals gather to drink.

geography.intro: Tadoba lies in the Chandrapur district of eastern Maharashtra and covers over 1,700 square kilometers of protected forest and buffer zones.

details.label: Landscape
details.value: Dry deciduous forest, meadows, lakes, and riverine belts

climate.description: Tadoba has dry summers and moderate winters. Wildlife sightings are excellent in the dry season when animals gather near water sources.

geography.conclusion: Tadoba is a thrilling wildlife escape for anyone seeking close encounters with India’s apex predators in their natural home.

activities.title: Jungle Safaris
activities.description: Twice daily guided safaris in core and buffer zones.
info: Zones: Moharli, Kolsa, Navegaon, Pangdi, etc.

activities.title: Wildlife Photography
activities.description: Capture stunning shots of animals, birds, and forest vistas.

activities.title: Birdwatching
activities.description: Ideal for spotting both resident and migratory birds.

attractions.title: Tadoba Lake
attractions.description: Freshwater lake drawing herds of deer, bison, and predators.

attractions.title: Moharli Gate
attractions.description: One of the most popular safari entry points with local accommodations nearby.

attractions.title: Kanha Village Eco Zone
attractions.description: Buffer zone with eco-resorts and birding trails.

marineLife.intro: While Tadoba is inland and has no marine life, it boasts rich terrestrial biodiversity and water-dependent species.

items.title: Amphibians & Reptiles
items.description: Monitor lizards, crocodiles, and frog species found near wetlands.

items.title: Waterlife
items.description: Turtles and freshwater fish inhabit Tadoba Lake and Andhari River.

items.title: Wetland Ecosystem
items.description: Supports dragonflies, aquatic birds, and plant species.

conclusion: Tadoba’s lakes and rivers sustain a web of life—from deer and tigers to fish and amphibians.
Its wetland pockets add rich diversity to the otherwise dry forest.

howToReach.title: By Air
details: Daily flights from Mumbai, Pune, Delhi, etc.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Chandrapur Station: 45 km from Moharli Gate
Nagpur Station: Major junction for all zones

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Well-connected via highways from Nagpur and Chandrapur
Taxis and buses available to core/buffer gates

bookingTips.description: Book safaris online in advance, especially for weekends and holidays.
Summer is best for tiger sightings, but carry sun protection.
Bring binoculars and a good camera for wildlife viewing.
